It would be pretty weird for the police =
to adopt a code that could be confused between going to the doctor, or seei=
ng someone shot.=A0 I sure wouldn't want to report a Code 7, and risk a SWA=

h.

--- On =
Sun, 5/10/09, Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@ yahoo.com> wrote:


From: Misty Dawn=
 <bulletbabea@ yahoo.com>
Subject: [EVP-ITC] The Seven - interesting tidbit=
 of info
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Sunday, May 10, 2009, 9:31 PM

=








Tonight at work I was talking to a state trooper, there had been an=
 accident. I asked him if there were any deaths (it was very very bad) and =
he said he didnt know so he got on his radio and called in and asked them i=
f it was a 7 at the site. They told him negative, and he told me the little=
 boy who was the worst off was still alive. I asked him why did you ask the=
m if it was a 7. He said code 7, I was asking them if they were dead. So if=
 you ever hear anyone call 7 over the radio that means someones dead.
=A0
J=
ust thought I would pass that on. I find it interesting since I know alot o=
f us have heard this before when used to describe who is speaking rather th=
an a name they say seven.
=A0
Misty
